  /**
   * Helper function to calculate an object's priority (H-value).
   *
   * From the original code: pri = L + (freq * 1.0e6 / size)
   * The 1.0e6 is a scaling factor to keep the (freq/size)
   * component significant.
   */
  // Use log-frequency and sqrt-size for finer discrimination and fairer scaling
  double calculate_priority(uint64_t freq, uint64_t size) {
    if (size == 0) {
      return pri_last_evict + (double)(freq) * 5.0e4;
    }
    // ln(freq+1) for gentle frequency boost, sqrt(size) for moderate size de-boost
    double freq_component = std::log((double)freq + 1.0);
    double size_component = std::sqrt((double)size);
    return pri_last_evict + freq_component * 5.0e4 / size_component;
  }
=======
  /**
   * Helper function to calculate an object's priority (H-value).
   *
   * From the original code: pri = L + (freq * 1.0e6 / size)
   * The 1.0e6 is a scaling factor to keep the (freq/size)
   * component significant.
   */
  // Use linear frequency and linear size for strong frequency-sensitivity and improved simplicity
  double calculate_priority(uint64_t freq, uint64_t size) {
    if (size == 0) {
      return pri_last_evict + (double)(freq) * 1.0e5;
    }
    // Classic GDSF: freq/size, with strong scaling for competitive recency/frequency balancing
    return pri_last_evict + (double)(freq) * 1.0e5 / (double)size;
  }
>>>>>>> REPLACE

    CacheObject new_obj;
    new_obj.size = obj_size;
    new_obj.frequency = 1;

    // Use current pri_last_evict for new insertions. Boost frequency for objects between 2KB-32KB to improve mid-size retention
    uint64_t adj_freq = new_obj.frequency;
    if(obj_size > 2048 && obj_size <= 32768) adj_freq += 2;
    if(obj_size > 32768) adj_freq += 1;
    double pri = calculate_priority(adj_freq, new_obj.size);

    PQNode new_node(pri, ++request_counter, obj_id);
    auto [set_iter, inserted] = priority_queue.insert(new_node);

    new_obj.pq_iterator = set_iter;
    cache_objects[obj_id] = new_obj;

    CacheObject new_obj;
    new_obj.size = obj_size;
    // Favor small and large objects on insert: small get quick recency, large get more time to prove utility

      new_obj.frequency = 2;
    else if (obj_size > 65536)
      new_obj.frequency = 2;
    else
      new_obj.frequency = 1;

    double pri = calculate_priority(new_obj.frequency, new_obj.size);

    PQNode new_node(pri, ++request_counter, obj_id);
    auto [set_iter, inserted] = priority_queue.insert(new_node);

    new_obj.pq_iterator = set_iter;
    cache_objects[obj_id] = new_obj;
